result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A Bradway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 134 days if defendant is revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant shall maintain full time employment (unless physically determined that defendant is not able to work).  Should defendant become unemployed he shall apply at 30 businesses/month that are hiring and file work search affidavits.

No use or consumption of intoxicants.

No contact with victim unless approved by victim and agent (injunction will need to be lifted).

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.

Undertake AODA assessment and  comply with treatment recommendations.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by calling the Work Release Unit  at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919 WITHIN 72 HOURS OF SENTENCING to set up an appointment.   The Work Release Units hours are 8:00 am-4:00 pm/Monday thru Friday. Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats. 946.52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven A Bradway

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven A Bradway in court with attorney Steven P. Smits.  Defendant Steven A Bradway in custody.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Smits request more time to discuss the Prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.

2ND DEGREE RECKLESSLY ENDANGERING SAFETY(USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON-DV)
CONDITIONS:   No contact with D.B.   No contact with 2345 Spring Meadow Dr. Neenah, WI.    May pick up belongings one time accompanied by police escort.  No alcohol consumption or possession.  Absolute sobriety.  Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.   Do not leave the State of Wisconsin.  No possession of firearms. Surrender all firearms to the Winnebago County Sheriff's Dept.

Defendant Steven A Bradway in court with attorney Steven P. Smits.  Defendant Steven A Bradway in custody.  Anthony Prekop appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Further proceedings scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 09:45 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.
